intro: Eremogone cliftonii, commonly known as Clifton's eremogone, is a perennial flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert landscapes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
